p: The slaughter process was carried out according to the Official Mexican Standard (NOM-033-SAG/ZOO, 2014) and the method of Méndez-Zamora et al. ( 2015a). A total of thirty 40-day-old chicks at the end of the growth period on day 40 from each treatment (5 birds per pen) were randomly selected for slaughter by cervical dislocation. Slaughter weight ( SW), and hot ( HCW; after removal of the head, feathers, and internal organs) and cold ( CCW; 24 h post-mortem) carcass weights were recorded to calculate hot ( HCY; (HCW/SW) × 100) and cold ( CCY; (CCW/SW) × 100) carcass yields. Breast meat ( BY), thigh ( TY), and leg ( LY) yields were estimated using piece weight and SW (piece yield = (piece weight/SW) × 100) (5 birds per pen).
